designScenario.name: Protection System
designScenario.description: The Protection System ensures continuous monitoring and safeguarding of aircraft structural integrity, passenger safety, and critical systems during normal and emergency operations. It integrates threat detection, environmental control, collision avoidance, and automated countermeasures using fail-safe architectures compliant with DO-178C and DO-254 standards. The system employs predictive analytics and cross-channel validation to maintain operational readiness across all flight phases.

details.description: Continuously monitor structural stress, cabin pressure, and external environmental threats using distributed sensor networks.
Execute automated decompression countermeasures and fire suppression protocols when critical thresholds are breached.
Achieve sub-3 second response time for collision avoidance system actuation from threat detection.
Maintain 99.999% data integrity in critical control loops between sensors and actuation systems.
Implement quadruple redundancy in flight control protection interfaces with Byzantine fault tolerance.
Ensure complete electrical isolation between primary and backup protection channels.
Support in-flight reconfiguration of protection parameters via cockpit interface with role-based access control.
Provide prognostic health monitoring capabilities with minimum 5000-hour component life prediction accuracy.

systemComponents.name: Threat Assessment Unit
systemComponents.description: Central decision-making module that correlates data from multiple sensor arrays to validate threats and initiate protection protocols.

subComponents.name: Neural Processing Core
subComponents.description: AI-accelerator for real-time pattern recognition in multi-sensor data streams

subComponents.name: Cross-Channel Validator
subComponents.description: Hardware comparator for consensus-based decision making across redundant inputs

systemComponents.name: Structural Integrity Monitor
systemComponents.description: Network of fiber-optic strain gauges and piezoelectric sensors detecting airframe stress and micro-fractures

subComponents.name: Acoustic Emission Sensors
subComponents.description: Detect material fatigue through ultrasonic frequency analysis

subComponents.name: SHM Processing Node
subComponents.description: Structural Health Monitoring computer performing time-domain reflectometry

systemComponents.name: Emergency Power Distribution
systemComponents.description: Triple-channel power routing system with galvanic isolation between protection subsystems

subComponents.name: Pyroswitch Controllers
subComponents.description: Explosive-activated circuit breakers for instantaneous fault isolation

subComponents.name: Supercapacitor Bank
subComponents.description: 750F rapid-discharge energy storage for critical system brownout protection

systemComponents.name: Environmental Protection Controller
systemComponents.description: Manages cabin pressure control, smoke evacuation, and fire suppression systems

subComponents.name: Dual-Stage Extinguisher Valves
subComponents.description: Electropneumatic controls for Halon and water mist suppression systems

subComponents.name: Outflow Ramp Actuators
subComponents.description: Electro-mechanical controls for emergency cabin decompression management

relationships.description: TAU aggregates and processes real-time structural health data from distributed SHM sensors
EPD contains dedicated power rails for TAU's redundant processing channels
EPC requires validated threat confirmation from TAU before executing suppression protocols
SHM nodes receive isolated power feeds from EPD's protected bus architecture

attributes.name: powerIsolation
